comment: More troubleshooting on efficiency of sequencing libraries. Sequencing library optimisation.

Better access to bioinformaticians/ statisticians to consult about study design and data analysis methods. I have applied unsuccessfully several times for different forms of support but have always had to solve problems "in spite of" SciLife instead of with "help of" Sci Life. Spend more bioinformatics resources on consultancy help rather than bigger schemes like the Wabi one. Serious groups with projects big enough to attract Wabi support already have necessary expertise and the SciLife support is just a way for them to get more people working on their project.

comment: I am a PI in a cryo-EM bag from Lund and I had to establish an account, but that one does not work. I contacted Cryo-EM person that asked me to create the account because it does not work and I can't use the account - but this cryo-EM personal ignores my questions and request for help.
The technologies are there, but it's either difficult to get the expertise and once you get them it's very expensive! NOT AFFORDABLE.
I am not missing any, but AKE IT accessible to everyone and NOT only to specific research groups!

comment: Phenomics

Given that many groups in Sweden are relative newcomers to cryoEM, and that the relevant expertise for data analysis is not present at every university, it would be most appreciated if SciLifeLab staff could offer more assistance with data analysis.
See a potential issue that SciLifeLab can compete with Swedish industrial alternatives as fees are not set by the market forces.

comment: We used to sequence everything in SciLife because of the good price and excelent service by the people there. Nowdays, the price for PE125 is to hight compare to other compagnies and as only novaseq will be available soon and that most of the time we don't generate enought samples to need a full lane of sequencing in novaseq, we will sadly do  our sequencing somewhere else. On average, we sequence 6 to 12 samples and need 20-30 millions reads for each. We don't need 600 millions reads for x2/x3 time the price of a hiseq lane.
